normalized: …i realized something.
i knew i shouldn't have eaten that meat.

name: hiroki
normalized: ahh, that one was really disgusting, three now…!
my leather shoes clapped onto the concrete asi came running up to a room lined with mailboxes.
there was a mailbox that had a blank space on itfor the purpose of preventing theft, but normally my name would be written on there like this: hiroki asaki.
i'm hiroki asaki.
i'm a sophomore that goes to kitano-mikaze high school, class 2-3, and i have just started living on my own this spring…

name: hiroki
normalized: please don't tell me i'm not going to make it…burp!
i had a room living in the quiet 23rd housing district and further west of there was my school.
after 25minutes of walking and 22 minutes on a train…burp.

name: hiroki
normalized: damn, i'm going to have to make a run for it today…!
it didn't look like i was going to make the trainby just walking with the distance i had left.
therewas barely enough time to make the express.

name: hiroki
normalized: uu…u.
i knew i shouldn't have eaten that meat…
although i called it meat, it was really salami.
salami sausage.
i got two of them for just over 6 bucks.
idiot.
it said it was made of high quality ingredients.
it's possible that that was the first meat dish i've had in a while since my miserable time living alone.

name: hiroki
normalized: uheh…the pepper is coming back up.
pepper.
that coarsely ground shit
to be honest, i, hiroki asaki, forever hate meat.
bird, pig, sheep, cow, horse, whale…any kind of animal meat.
i don't eat anything that routinely causes things like bad heartburn and diarrhea.
if that's the case why the heck did i think it wasa good idea eating an entire smoked sausage filledwith lard and spices this morning…
the reason was simple: i wasn't going to be lateagain today.
the school gates had shut before my eyes yesterdayand the day before yesterday.
or perhaps i should sayi wasn't able to get through them before they shut.
i've been late two days this week.
and i'm one step away from penal regulation.
i was out of vegetables and cereal that i needed forenergy, so i had grabbed some meat thinking that i was going to try and get to school well on time today.
nevertheless, drinking some water to keep mynauseous stomach in check had wasted precious time.

name: hiroki
normalized: i should have gotten my priorities straightand eaten an adult food like tofu…
breaking off into an energetic run once again,i left my comfortably pleasant new abode.
a trainis a train, a station a station.
i can make the express.
my apartment building was a surprisingly distant15 walking minutes from the station.
but i was apretty good medium-range runner.

name: hiroki
normalized: hii, hii…upu!
i moved my hands and feet with all of my might,sending out instructions to a body that held aheavy stomach and a groggy head.

name: hiroki
normalized: i need to buy a bicycle, i have to save up andbuy a bicycle…whaa
as i rounded the last corner with the clip-clappingof my leather shoes and came down road to the station…an announcement streamed out.
i heard sounds of a train coming towards the platform.
it was the last that could save me from being late.
i had never been on time with the train that came after.
i felt it was a little dangerous, but i chose to makea run for it towards the stairway to the ticket gate bytraversing across an intersection.

name: hiroki
normalized: i'm going to make it…!
while envisioning myself hurdling over the guardrail,i had made it just past the white line in the middleof the road when….

name: hiroki
normalized: nn…?
…i was hit by a car.

name: hiroki
normalized: （ehh…?
dohn" "bohn"….
those were the sort of noises ofmy body separating completely from the ground and flyingup into the air like a perfectly folded paper airplane.
it was an incredible impact.
my bag flew off diagonally.
my limbs were already greatly disjointed.
my eyes had locked with the truck driver's,which seemed to be frozen in place staring at me….
it wasn't my life flashing before my eyes.
instead, it was just one thought.
"yeah, i'm done for.
" i had accepted my fate.
whether or not it was the reason for not being able to see my life flash before my eyes, i was seeing pure white.
it was as if time had stopped.
i couldn't feel anything.
to speak nothing of beingconcerned about anything, rather, it almost feltexhilarating how my body had become so light.
the heartburn from the salami had vanished too.
maybe my spirit was already in the midst of rising up to heaven.
my soul, on its deathbed, was soaring up towards that other place and was approaching the tops of the clouds where the kingdom of heaven lie, when…

name: hiroki
normalized: eh…
i was suddenly perfectly aware of my own body again.

name: hiroki
normalized: nn?
eh…?
i acted like a total buffoon as i looked around in an oafish voice.
my hands and feet were at my sides and i could feel the crunchy ground underneath.
the ground, or perhaps i should say the road, or uh, the sidewalk, or…

name: hiroki
normalized: i'm dead, aren't i…?
no, not at all.
not even one injury.
it was as if there wasn't a pain anywhere in my body.
it didn't appear that i was paralyzed either.
there wasn't even a scratch and far from any broken bones, and the asphalt felt rightly cold on my ass, and i even felt queasy too.
in short, i was unhurt.
it was a damned miracle.
what in the world hadhappened to my body in the time i was unconscious?
the truck that should have run me over had spedaway from the hit-and-run.
certainly it was my fault and i didn't blamethe driver.
or rather, it was really great nothinghad happened.

name: hiroki
normalized: great, no, miraculous…
being in a head-on collision with a truck, i spat out a sigh of relief.
i should be soaring up high to heaven and yet here i was without a scratch.
that was why i didn't see my life flash before me.
all the things that i had regrets about.
oh right, i had often changed schools due to my parents work, huh
moving all the time became a burden on me and soi declared i was going to stay here: i, hiroki asaki, was renting an apartment and living alone.
thank you!
i had wanted to tell everyone that i had becomethe first of my classmates to live alone.
had itsurprised me that living alone was no fun?
cleaning, cooking, and laundry was quite tiresome.
and it was really lonely.
there was no one to wakeme when i slept in.
and i self-indulged too much.
thanks to that, i always got up at the last moment.
uehpu.
that heartburn.
as i thought, it would bebetter to start eating tofu all the time.
if i hadn't eaten that meat, i wouldn't be lateand i wouldn't have had to run and end up gettinghit by a truck.

name: hiroki
normalized: ma, but i'm just happy that i'm alive…uh oh!
i energetically stood up and gathered mytumbled over bag beside me.
at any rate,i have to get on that train.
i absolutely had to tell my friends in classabout this.
i ran up the staircase and towardsthe ticket gate.
i was looking forward to school.
